input.description:
String Value - The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Example: BMC_ARS_System, BMC_Remedyforce
NOTE: This not supported by HP ServiceCenter and ServiceNow

An XML document providing the data template for single or multiple Concept elements.The task concept is an XML document containing specific elements used to assign multiple values to a single context item. Each value is associated with an element of the Concept.

output.description: An XML document providing the data template for single or multiple Concept elements.The task concept is an XML document containing specific elements used to assign multiple values to a single context item. Each value is associated with an element of the Concept.
An XML document containing failed tasks.
String Value - Count of successful tasks.
String Value - Count of tasks that failed.

String Value - Indicates whether or not the process completed successfully.
Valid values: success, failure.
String Value - A process specific explanation for the value of success status.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <schema>${schema name}</schema> <query> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">'10006803'="${task id}" AND '1000000206'="${configuration item name}"</xsl:text> </query> <fields> <xsl:copy-of select="//field" /> </fields> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <objects> <queryString> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">Select Id from BMCServiceDesk__BMC_CommonCILink__c where BMCServiceDesk__FKTask__c = '${task name}' and BMCServiceDesk__CIInstance__c = '${instance name}'</xsl:text> </queryString> </objects> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

xpath-expression.xpath: concat("Unable to delete task relationship because of the following: ", .)
concat("Unable to delete task relationship because of the following: ", .)

documentation.description:
This workflow will delete a realtionship between a given task and a given configuration item.
NOTE: This not supported by HP ServiceCenter
